Zipper Clause.definition: a clause in a labor contract indicating that the agreement is an exclusive and complete expression of consent NOTE
Zipper Clause.origin: [from the comparison of such a clause to the closing action of a zipper]

1.1: a clause in a labor contract indicating that the agreement is an exclusive and complete expression of consent
1.note: A zipper clause may constitute a waiver of the right to bargain over issues negotiated in or outside the terms of a contract until its expiration.
